szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.misc

Class GDXActorRectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.misc.GDXRectangle
      • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.misc.GDXActorRectangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActorRectangle, Rectangle

    public class GDXActorRectangle
extends GDXRectangle
implements ActorRectangle
    An extension to the base GDXRectangle descriptor of a game object with added functionality for use by actors.

    • Method Detail

      • translate

        public void translate(Direction dir,
                      int dxAbs,
                      int dyAbs)
        Description copied from interface: ActorRectangle

        Changes this rectangle's centerX, centerY, rectangleX and rectangleY positions and the tunnel cell if necessary, by changing these positions according to the following rules:

        int dx += dxAbs*dir.getXStep(); int dy += dyAbs*dir.getYStep(); centerX += dx; centerY += dy; rectangleX += dx, rectangleY += dy;

        Note that even if both coordinate shifts passed are nonzero, constraints placed upon movement by the xStep and yStep attributes of each Direction value will cause the shift in coordinates to be restricted to only the vertical or horizontal coordinates.

        If the new position is outside any tunnel cell, making it impossible to move there, the current tunnel cell is set to the last tunnel cell in the given direction, with coordinates set appropriately.

        Specified by:
        translate in interface ActorRectangle
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction of movement.
        dxAbs - the absolute value of the shift in horizontal coordinates
        dyAbs - the absolute value of the shift in vertical coordinates

      • getCurrentPosition

        public TunnelCellUpdatable getCurrentPosition()
        Description copied from interface: ActorRectangle
        Returns the tunnel cell where this rectangle's centerX and centerY coordinates are located in.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentPosition in interface ActorRectangle
        Returns:
        the tunnel cell containing the centerX and centerY coordinates of this rectangle.
